The most common reason for the fetal head's occiput-posterior position during labour is:
questions.solution:
The most common reason for the fetal head's occiput-posterior position during labor is deflexion of the fetal head. Deflexion refers to the position of the baby's head in which the chin is tucked into the chest, causing the occiput (the back of the baby's head) to be the presenting part of the baby during labor. This can make it difficult for the baby's head to rotate to the anterior position during labor, resulting in an occiput-posterior position.

Maternal obesity and an android pelvis (a pelvis with a narrow outlet) can also contribute to an occiput-posterior position, but they are not the most common reasons. Multiparity (having given birth before) is not typically associated with an occiput-posterior position.

questions.text: The most common cause of breech presentation is:
questions.solution:
Prematurity
Incidence 
Incidence of breech presentations at term is 3-4%
The incidence falls with gestational age, being 20% at 28 weeks, 16% at 32 weeks, falling to 3-4% at term (as most breeches will turn spontaneously by 36 weeks). 
So the comonest cause for breech presentation is prematurity. 

Incidence
- Incidence of breech presentations at term is 3-4%.
- The incidence falls with gestational age, being 20% at 28 weeks, 16% at 32 weeks, falling to 3-4% at term (as most breeches will turn spontaneously by 36 weeks).
- So the commonest cause for breech presentation is prematurity.

questions.text: The most typical congenital abnormality observed in pregnancy with diabetes mellitus is:
questions.solution: Ventricular septal defect is the most common anomaly but spina bifida is the most specific anomaly.

questions.text: Which of the following drug's use is contra-indicated during pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Option is 4: Enalapril
  • Angiotensin-converting enzyme(ACE) inhibitors are avoided in pregnancy due to their teratogenic potential to cause organ hypoplasia.
  • The most commonly affected organs are the kidneys and lungs.
  • ACE inhibitors must be discontinued as soon as a diagnosis of pregnancy is made.
  • It has been found that ACE inhibitors have been associated with renal developmental defects when administered in the third trimester of pregnancy or earlier.

questions.text: Which of the following renal disorder is related to the worst pregnancy outcome?
questions.solution:
SLE
For women with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), pregnancy increases likelihood of flare. These can occur at any stage, and are more difficult to diagnose, as symptoms overlap those of normal pregnancy.

questions.text: More than half of a perimenopausal woman's myometrial invasion, vaginal metastasis, and inguinal lymph node metastasis are present in her well-differentiated uterine adenocarcinoma. She is staged as:
questions.solution:
Inguinal metastasis are suggestive of stage 4b
Stage Description
I Tumor confined to the uterus 
IA <50% invasion of the myometrium 
IB \(\geq 50 \%\) invasion of the myometrium 
II Tumor invades the cervical stoma but does not extend beyond the uterus
III Local or regional spread of tumor 
IIIA Serosal or adnexal invasion 
IIIB  Vaginal or parametrical involvement 
IIIC  Metastasis to pelvic or paraaortic lymph nodes
IIIC1 Pelvic lymph node involvement
IIIC2 Paraaortic lymph node involvement (with or without pelvic nodes)
IV  Extension to the pelvic wall, lower one-third of the vagina, or hydronephrosis or nonfunctioning kidney
IVA  Invasion of bladder or bowel mucosa
IVB Distant metastases, including abdominal or involvement of inguinal lymph nodes

For the past five years, a 9-year-old boy has had steroid-dependent nephrotic syndrome. He exhibits cushingoid characteristics and has received corticosteroids practically continuously during this time. There are bilateral subcapsular cataracts and a blood pressure of 150/96 mmHg. The recommended treatment is:
questions.solution:
In patients with Frequent Relapsing Nephrotic Syndrome or Steroid Dependence - Levamisole is the preferred steroid-sparing agent. However, a 12-week course of Cyclophosphamide is preferred over Levamisole in patients with evidence of severe steroid toxicity(like the example given in question - cataracts and uncontrolled hypertension) or having compliance issues. Hence in the above question, option(2) is a better answer as compared to option (1). 



Reference
Pediatric Nephrology 6th Edition by RN Srivastava, Arvind Bagga. Page 203.

The prevalence of neural tube abnormalities is decreased when the following substance is used before conception:
questions.solution:
Folic acid
CDC urges all women of reproductive age to take 400 micrograms (mcg) of folic acid each day, in addition to consuming food with folate from a varied diet, to help prevent some major birth defects of the baby’s brain (anencephaly) and spine (spina bifida).
Women who have already had a pregnancy affected by a neural tube defect should consult with their healthcare provider. CDC recommends that these women consume 4,000 mcg of folic acid each day one month before becoming pregnant and through the first 3 months of pregnancy.

questions.text: Regarding the use of clonidine to treat hypertension, which of the following assertion is untrue?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer is 2: Increase in LDL-cholesterol in prolonged use
 
  • Clonidine is an alpha-2 receptor agonist and a centrally acting HTN agent. It treats HTN by stimulating presynaptic α2 receptors in the vasomotor centre in the brainstem.
  • This binding has a sympatholytic effect, by suppressing the release of NE and other sympathomimetics (option A).
  • It can be given with other anti-hypertensives (option D).
  • Dry mouth and sedation are the major side effects of clonidine (option C). It can also cause impotency and constipation.

questions.text: Choose the incorrect statement regarding sotalol.
The time needed to reach steady state levels for medications with first-order kinetics can be anticipated from:
Which of the following drugs is not metabolised by acetylation?
questions.solution:
Correct option is 3: Ketoconazole
Acetylation is a phase II metabolic reaction where compounds having amino or hydrazine residues are conjugated with the help of acetyl coenzyme-A. Ketoconazole does not undergo acetylation.
Drugs that undergo acetylation are:
  • Sulfonamides
  • Hydralazine
  • Isoniazid
  • PAS
  • Dapsone
  • Clonazepam
  • Procainamide

questions.text: Which of the following cephalosporins does not have good activity against Pseudomonas aeruginosa?
Low-dose hormonal contraceptives primarily influence:
questions.solution:
Cervix
The mechanism of action of low dose pills  is thickening of the cervical mucus to block sperm entry into the upper genital tract.

While the conventional oral contraceptive pills act by inhibiting ovulation.

A week or so after his passing, she clearly heard his voice speaking to her from another room in the same manner that he always did. She went to look but can't seem to find anything. She then frequently overheard him speaking to her and would also address her daily concerns with him. However, she became anxious and depressed as a result of his notion, which confused her.
